events.name: April/2016 - Open Space (Estimation)
events.description: Open Space Theme: Estimations Estimation, estimation, estimation : what a hot topic ! Estimation, a simple word with so many interpretations and uses. Add the word Agile and the confusion is guaranteed. Some of the common questions are : Is commitment? A date? A prediction? A guess? What is it anyway ? How do we do it ? Are there reliable techniques ? Estimates are always wrong, why do we need them ? Do you want to know more about it ? Are you puzzled about it ? Do you know techniques that could help others ? Would you like to share experiences ? Do you have a burning question ? Come over and join us ! Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology.  Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT).  It is 10 minutes walk from Raffles Place MRT station or 5 minutes walk from  Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room. Rohit from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he will make the trips are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm There is no guarantee of trips after 7:45pm.
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: HackerspaceSG Geekup Apr 2016: Starting a DEF CON Group in Singapore
events.description:
Come meet Jayson E Street, author of the book “Dissecting the hack: The F0rb1dd3n Network” plus creator of the site http://dissectingthehack.com. He has also spoken at DEFCON, DerbyCon, UCON & at several other ‘CONs & colleges on a variety of Information Security subjects.

For the uninitiaited, he will share about DEFCON. This will be an open discussion. He will share several entertaining stories of his travels & exploits but mostly will be there to answer questions about hacking, blue team, red team and DEF CON Groups! So come with questions and expect a few answers and a lot of great hugs! 

He has been tasked by DEFCON to get a Def Con Group(DCG) going in Singapore, So he also hopes to meet people interested in starting a DCG that doesn't fizzle out. Specifically, he is looking for a willing/unwilling DCG POC https://defcongroups.org/dcgpocfaq.html

He will also be happy to do a QnA.


Q: What are DEF CON Groups?

A: The DEF CON Groups were spawned from the annual DEF CON security conference in Las Vegas. The DEF CON Groups (DCGs or DC-Groups) are a gathering point for folks interested in the alternate applications of modern technology, referred to properly as 'hacking'. DCGs are not intended to compete with any other computer groups, such as 2600, but rather to provide yet another gathering place for the discussion of technology and security topics. DCG meetings are open to anyone, regardless of their skill, age, job, gender, etc. DCGs are designed to help you learn new things, meet new people, mentor others in areas you may be strong in, and provide some cohesion within the hacker culture and it's members.
